abstract: Seeking more customers for its Windows phones, Microsoft is allowing employees to work on app development in their spare time.
snippet: Seeking more customers for its Windows phones, Microsoft is allowing employees to work on app development in their spare time.
lead_paragraph: IF you have a smartphone, you probably have apps on it to check the news, play games, help with shopping or further a hobby like travel or bird-watching. But chances are that you don’t yet have Bubblegum  a new app that lets you instantly dress up cellphone photos, tinting them in sepia or adding neon blue highlights, for instance, and then share the results on Facebook.

headline.main: Moonlighting Within Microsoft, in Pursuit of New Apps
headline.print_headline: Moonlighting Within Microsoft, in Pursuit of New Apps
